etymologies: late Middle English: from dialect asp(in the same sense) + -en, forming an adjective later used as a noun (late 16th century)

definitions: a poplar tree with rounded, long-stalked, and typically coarsely toothed leaves that tremble in even a slight breeze.

notes.text: Genus Populus, family Salicaceae: several species, in particular the North American quaking aspen (P. tremuloides) and bigtooth aspen (P. grandidentata) and the European P. tremula

shortDefinitions: poplar tree with small rounded long-stalked leaves that tremble in breeze
